author: jfarcand
msg: Use the catalina.properties file to customize the package protection/access. This new security m
echanism enable the customization, at runtime, of which package should be protected.
the following package will be protected by default:
o.a.catalina
o.a.jasper(*)
o.a.coyote
o.a.tomcat.util
(*) Tomcat 5 is broken when a JSP use a class from jsp20el.jar and when the SecurityManager is t
urned on. Even if you remove all the protection, Tomcat fail to properly runs the example.
o.a.coyote.tomcat5 has been securized in order to support package protection.

author: glenn
msg: Import perl scripts for analyzing mod_jk logs and generating graphs/reports

author: mturk
msg: Fix the disabling of the JNI in the multiprocess servers.
Question: Can we disable the JNI if there is more then one child process?

author: costin
msg: Added support for coyote properties and 'shortcuts'.
This should solve a number of problems where information
was not passed from server.xml to jk.
Long term we should just consolidate all the config - but that'll
take a bit more time.

author: costin

pool - and then possibly do the conf on the TP
